drills.name: Drill 1: small front handspring
drills.description: Perform a handstand on stacked mats and fall straight over onto a soft crash-mat. Spot: The spot must help straighten the handstand. First fix the correct handstand position: legs staright, pushing tall on the shoulders, head neautral between arms, etc. Then spot the fall.

drills.name: Drill 2: Spot front handspring from block
drills.description: From a block or stacked mats perform a handtand and bring the legs over onto a bridge towards the ground with assisted help. Spot: The spotter place one hand on the performer's shoulder and the other hand on the performer's back thighs (hamstrings). If the performer is heavy, try placing one hand on his/her uppe, in order to slow down a possible crash.
